security_audit.summary: This skill is a pure markdown prompt file with no executable code. It provides refactoring guidance and workflow instructions for AI agents. No network calls, no file system access beyond standard framework tools, no external commands, no environment variable access patterns.

content.value_statement: Manual code refactoring is time-consuming and risky. This skill provides systematic refactoring guidance including DRY principle application, complexity reduction, and regression prevention through AI-powered analysis and recommendations.
actual_capabilities: Apply DRY principle to eliminate duplicate code
limitations: Does not modify code without explicit approval
Cannot refactor across multiple unrelated modules simultaneously
Requires Regression Guardian skill for validation
Does not create new features during refactoring

use_cases.title: Reduce Code Duplication
use_cases.description: Identify and eliminate duplicate code patterns across your codebase while maintaining functionality

use_cases.title: Improve Code Maintainability
use_cases.description: Apply systematic refactoring to improve code organization and reduce complexity

use_cases.title: Optimize Performance
use_cases.description: Address performance issues like N+1 queries and unnecessary loop iterations

prompt_templates.title: Basic Refactor Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor the code in {file_path}. Focus on applying DRY principles and reducing complexity.

prompt_templates.title: Performance Focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze {file_path} for N+1 query problems and performance bottlenecks. Provide specific refactoring suggestions.

prompt_templates.title: Frontend Refactoring
prompt_templates.prompt: Refactor the React component at {file_path}. Extract custom hooks and separate presentational and container components.

prompt_templates.title: Full Refactoring
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform comprehensive refactoring on {file_path}. Apply DRY principle, reduce complexity, improve naming, and coordinate with Regression Guardian for validation.

output_examples.input: Refactor the duplicate validation logic in user_service.java
output: Identified 3 locations with duplicate user validation code
Suggested regression test run with Regression Guardian

best_practices: Always work in feature branches with issue numbers in branch names
Run tests after each small refactoring step
Coordinate with Regression Guardian before finalizing changes
Remove unused code using IDE warnings as a guide
anti_patterns: Refactoring without creating a backup branch first
Skipping regression testing after code changes
Making large-scale changes instead of small incremental steps
Refactoring without understanding the original intent

faq.question: Which programming languages does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill includes patterns for Java backend and TypeScript React frontend. Core refactoring principles apply to any language.

faq.question: What is the recommended complexity threshold?
faq.answer: The skill targets cyclomatic complexity of 15 or below for maintainable code.

faq.question: How does this skill integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: It coordinates with Regression Guardian for validation and uses Read, Edit, and Bash tools provided by the AI framework.

faq.question: Is my codebase data safe during refactoring?
faq.answer: The skill only reads files you specify and edits with your approval. No code is modified without explicit direction.

faq.question: What if tests fail after refactoring?
faq.answer: The skill provides rollback guidance. Analyze the failure, adjust refactoring approach, and try smaller incremental changes.

faq.question: How is this different from manual code review?
faq.answer: This skill provides systematic analysis, pattern detection, and step-by-step guidance that supplements human judgment.
